solution_line_template: Store A has a ${store_a_full_price} x {store_a_discount_percentage} = $<<{store_a_full_price}*{store_a_discount_percentage}={store_a_discount_amount}>>{store_a_discount_amount} discount.
So the smartphone from store A will only cost ${store_a_full_price} - ${store_a_discount_amount} = $<<{store_a_full_price}-{store_a_discount_amount}={store_a_final_price}>>{store_a_final_price}.
Store B has a ${store_b_full_price} x {store_b_discount_percentage} = $<<{store_b_full_price}*{store_b_discount_percentage}={store_b_discount_amount}>>{store_b_discount_amount} discount.
So the smartphone from store B will only cost ${store_b_full_price} - ${store_b_discount_amount} = $<<{store_b_full_price}-{store_b_discount_amount}={store_b_final_price}>>{store_b_final_price}.
Thus, store A's smartphone is ${store_b_final_price} - ${store_a_final_price} = $<<{store_b_final_price}-{store_a_final_price}={price_difference}>>{price_difference} cheaper than that of store B.
